Section 4: Handling and Storage of Hazardous Materials and the Appropriate Disposal of Bio-contaminants 

Things to Remember About Poison Centers

Let's discuses some important information to remember about Poison Centers. The following short video introduces you to the uses and benefits of the Poison Help Line.

  • Resource
  • Resolves Most Concerns
  • Call First
  • Post Number
  • 1-800-222-1222

Great resource for potential poisoning information 

Poison Centers are a valuable resource for information on potential poisoning. 

Saves time and Money, most concerns resolved

A call to a Poison Center can save you time and money. If you are suspecting a poisoning call the Poison Center. Most of your concerns will be resolved over the phone. 

Do not automatically induce vomiting, call poison control center first & follow their instructions

It is important to add that you should not automatically induce vomiting. There are some substances that could cause additional damage if vomited up. First call the Poison Center and follow their directions on whether or not to induce vomiting.

Post number near phones, program in cell phones

The Poison Center number should be posted in readily visible locations near each telephone. It should also be programmed into the cell phones of child care providers so it can be easily accessed in the event of an accidental poisoning. As mentioned before there is an app for smartphones which can be used to scan barcodes to determine the specific substances more quickly.

Call 1-800-222-1222

The phone number for the Poison Control Center is 1-800-222-1222.
